intro: Swertia trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of East Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its common name. Swertia trichotoma is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
